retain clear ideas about a book from
eading a review, no matter how ex¬
haustive. One has to read the book
in order to appreciate it, and it was
my object to impress upon Jewish
lovers of literarure their duty to take
up the book of Schnitzler which I
consider one of the, if not the strong¬
est presentation of Jewish sentiment
in our days. If they take it up, they
will not lay it down without haying
read it over and over again, for the
author will fascinate themf as ge fas¬
einated me.
Gorrnan Drufsen.

retain clear ideas about a book from eading a review, no matter how ex¬ haustive. One has to read the book in order to appreciate it, and it was my object to impress upon Jewish lovers of literarure their duty to take up the book of Schnitzler which I consider one of the, if not the strong¬ est presentation of Jewish sentiment in our days. If they take it up, they will not lay it down without haying read it over and over again, for the author will fascinate themf as ge fas¬ einated me. Gorrnan Drufsen. 1
